communications

Class VisionProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • communications.VisionProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class VisionProcessor
extends java.lang.Thread
    This is the class that does the processing of the image, and can be called as many times as necessary.

    PROCESSOR COMMANDS:
    -1: process image and send it over the socket
    -2: set the threshold values from the socket
    -3: reserved just in case for the main socket for requesting new sockets
    -4: sets the operations and their parameters (such as Dilation and Erosion)
    -5: requests the thread to continuously process images
    -6: requests to save the raw image to the destination provided
    -7: requests to save the processed image to the destination provided
    -8: load a configuration file saved from the thresholdutility program

    Author:
    Ryan McGee

    • Field Detail

      • blobs

        public java.util.ArrayList<int[]> blobs
        ArrayList of integer arrays, containing blob information.
        (They are all rectangles)


        blobs[0] = x coordinate
        blobs[1] = y coordinate
        blobs[2] = width
        blobs[3] = height

      • blobsAreNew

        public volatile boolean blobsAreNew
        Will display true only if the program just received new blobs. You can change this if you are finished using this set of blobs and want to wait for the next to send.

      • loadConfig

        public void loadConfig(java.lang.String destination)
        Load a configuration file saved from the Threshold Utility.
        Parameters:
        destination - @param destination the path to the file; it MUST contain the FULL path, right down to the .cfg at the end.

      • getWidestBlob

        public int[] getWidestBlob(java.util.ArrayList<int[]> blobs)
        Gets the widest blob from the ArrayList of blobs
        Parameters:
        blobs -
        Returns:
        int array: The widest blob with [0] = top left x coordinate, [1] = y, [2] = width, [3] = height

      • threshold

        public void threshold(int blue,
                      int green,
                      int red,
                      int brightness,
                      double percent)
        Sets the threshold values in BGR format, ranging from 0-255 and brightness from -255 to 255. This will automatically set the lower and upper boundaries based on the range and input values.
        Parameters:
        blue - Average blue value
        green - Average green value
        red - Average red value
        brightness - brightness value, added to BGR matrix as a scalar
        percent - percentage value expressed as a number between 0 and 1

      • sendOperations

        public void sendOperations()
        Tells the Raspberry pi what must be done in what order, and with which parameters. This runs after operations have been set (dilation, erosion, threshold), and should NOT be run continuously.

      • dilate

        public void dilate(int size,
                   int iterations)
        Dilate blobs on the image (make all blobs larger from their middle). Useful for resizing the blobs back to normal after erosion, or closing a blob.
        Parameters:
        size - How large the dilation should make the blobs
        iterations - How many times the dilation should run

      • erode

        public void erode(int size,
                  int iterations)
        Erode the image (make all blobs smaller from their middle). Useful for removing small objects.
        Parameters:
        size - How small the erosion should make the blobs
        iterations - How many times it should be eroded

      • removeSmallObjects

        public void removeSmallObjects(int size)
        Removes objects with an area less than the size given, without altering the size of other blobs (does not use erosion).
        Parameters:
        size - size of the blobs that should be removed

      • saveRawImage

        public void saveRawImage(java.lang.String destination)
        Requests that the Raspberry Pi saves the camera picture(WITH brightness change) before processing it. This is useful for finding threshold values.
        Parameters:
        destination - The path you want the file to save to. DO NOT add the file name or extension.

      • saveProcessedImage

        public void saveProcessedImage(java.lang.String destination)
        Requests that the Raspberry Pi saves the camera picture after processing it. This is useful for finding the correct values for aiming.
        Parameters:
        destination - The path you want the file to save to. DO NOT add the file name or extension.

      • stopThread

        public void stopThread()
        Halts requests for images, closes listeners, sockets and I/O streams, and ends the thread. Any requests made for single images will be discarded unless creating a new object.

        NOTE: to stop the Vision Processor threads (in the case of enabling / disabling) the RaspberryPi object MUST call the stopAllThreads function before the VisionProcessor object does. (It is a case of timing between sockets). If you are still getting a Connection abort: socket write error on EITHER the rio or the pi, increase the time delay in VisionProcessor.run().

      • getParticleReport

        public void getParticleReport()
        Gets an array of the information of all the blobs

      • filterAspectRatio

        public void filterAspectRatio(double arg0,
                              double arg1,
                              VisionProcessor.AspectRatio a)
        Filters out all blobs that do not have the aspect ratio falling in the range of the lowerBound and upperBound specified, or the given aspect ratio give or take the tolerance times that aspect ratio.
        NOTE: the aspect ratio is (width / height), so a value above one is wider than tall, etc.
        Parameters:
        arg0 - If AspectRatio is set to BOUNDARY, this is the lower boundary of acceptable aspect ratios. Else if it is set to TOLERANCE, this is the desired aspect ratio.
        arg1 - If AspectRatio is set to BOUNDARY, this is the upper boundary of acceptable aspect ratios. Else if it is set to TOLERANCE, this is the tolerance.
        useTolerance -
